title: Tow truck driver shot in Elgin Elgin Courier-News
text:
A 45-year-old man working for a tow relocation service was shot early Sunday morning on Fleetwood Drive as he attempted to tow a car, Elgin police said.
Police responded to Presence St. Joseph Hospital in Elgin at 1:53 a.m. after a man arrived at the hospital with a gunshot wound, according to a police report. The victim was treated at the hospital for non-life-threatening injuries, the release said.
The victim told police he was in the 1200 block of Fleetwood Drive attempting to tow a vehicle when he was confronted by an unknown subject, the report said. A verbal altercation began, and the man was shot, the release said.
An acquaintance drove the victim to the hospital, according to the report.
Elgin's Major Investigation Divisions detectives are investigating and ask anyone with information to contact their office at 847-289-2600. Individuals also can provide anonymous tips or information via the crime line at 847-695-4195 or by texting 847411 and including ELGINPD in the beginning of the text, along with the message and/or tip information.
